headline.main: CHANGTEH EXPELS JAPANESE FORCES; Chinese Also Storm Suburbs of Ichang and Gain North of the Yangtze

lead_paragraph: CHUNGKING, China, Dec. 1 (U.P.) -- Chinese forces, having thrown Japanese troops out of the Hunan Province road junction of Changteh, have stormed the eastern suburbs of Japanese-held Ichang and broken into two important towns on the Ichang-Hankow highway north of the Yangtze River, a special Chinese communique said today.
abstract: Chinese forces expel Jap troops, Changteh; retake Tehshan and Yuan River ferry station; attack Ichang suburbs; enter Tangyang and Kingmen; wipe out invaders and retake several towns west of Lake Tungting; US and Chinese fliers bomb Jap forces, Changteh area; Chinese retake Taoyuan, Shihmen and Tsangkang; inflict casualties on Jap units near Hofu; attack Lihsien; Jap troops evacuate Linli; Domei repts Allied planes raid, Hong Kong
